Guidelines to Save and Back Up Your Wallet



The information below is step by step guide on saving and backing up your wallet. If you lose ownership of your private key or the keystore file it cannot be recovered, understanding the steps below is crucial to secure your access to your wallet.

Steps

  1. Go to https://www.testwallet.aion.network/.
  2. Enter a strong but easy to remember password. Do not forget it.
    • This encrypts (protects) your private key. It does not generate your private key. This password alone will not be enough to access your Aion.
  3. Click the "Generate Wallet" button.
  4. Download your Keystore / UTC file & save this file to a USB drive.
    • This is the encrypted version of your private key. You need the password to access it. It is safer than your unencrypted private key but you must have your password to access it in the future.
  5. Read the warning. If you understand it, click the "I understand. Continue" button.
  6. Print multiple copies of your paper wallet backup and/or carefully hand-write the private key on a piece of paper.
    • If you are writing it, it is recommend you write it 2 or 3 times and cross check, also it is a good practise to maintain multiple copies
  7. Copy & paste your address into a text document somewhere.
    • Search your address on https://dashboard.aion.network/. Bookmark this page. This is how you will view your balance at any time
  8. Send a small amount of Aion (0.05 Aion) from your previous wallet or exchange to your new wallet.
  9. Unlock your new wallet from the Keystore / UTC file on your USB drive or via the private key that you printed out. Ensure it unlocks the wallet you are sent to and matches the bookmark you have.
    • Do not simply leave your new wallet open. Pretend you are coming back a year later to access your riches. Can you do it?
  10. Send a small amount of Aion (0.05 Aion) from this new wallet to another address.
  11. Ensure you have recorded all necessary bits of information and the addresses match at all times. If they don't, you mis-wrote something somewhere. That means it's time to start from the beginning in order to make sure you never lose access to your funds.

Safe Storage of Backups

It is recommended that you store backups of both forms of your key (the Keystore / UTC file version and paper wallet version) in physically separate, offline environments.This prevents loss of the private key & password due to unforseen events.


We cannot recover your key or password

It is highly recommeneded that you maintain multiple copies and secure access to your private key, keystore file, and password

Aion Wallet is not a web wallet and cannot recover your private key or password, access your account, move funds, recover funds, nor cancel/reverse transactions.
